definition: male/staminate/grand/imposing/powerful/mighty/person or state having great power and influence

sentences.english: Lions, the symbol of the southwest of France which represents power and stateliness .
sentences.chinese: 而雄獅是法國西南部的象徵，代表着力量和威嚴。

sentences.english: Hacksaw Ridge and Lion also received six nods.
sentences.chinese: 《血戰鋼鋸嶺》和《雄獅》也獲得六項提名。

sentences.english: The lion roared one last time, and we were all his cubs.
sentences.chinese: 我們作爲晚輩，聆聽着這頭雄獅最後一次的咆哮。

sentences.english: It is said that Lion King Gesar Ling States of Horse Circle on here.
sentences.chinese: 相傳嶺國雄獅王格薩爾的馬圈就在此地。

sentences.english: Who let the lions have the mane instead of the lionesses?
Male lions steal food from their women and children, even in times of hunger.
sentences.chinese: 雄獅經常偷雌獅和幼獅的食物，即使是在饑荒的季節。

sentences.english: Saddam, who bragged that the Babylonian lion on behalf of Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 薩達姆自詡爲巴比倫的雄獅在此代表伊拉克。

sentences.english: Though your enemy seem a mouse, yet watch him like a lion.
sentences.chinese: 縱使敵人小如鼠，亦須當作雄獅看。

sentences.english: They are similar to winged lions, the symbol of the southwest of France which represents power and stateliness .
sentences.chinese: 而雄獅是法國西南部的象徵，代表着力量和威嚴。

sentences.english: He has subjugated a male lion.
March comes in like a lion and goes out like a lamb.
sentences.chinese: 三月來如雄獅，去如綿羊。

sentences.english: Will a new pride of economic lions take their place beside the Chinese dragon and the Indian tiger?
sentences.chinese: 中國龍和印度虎身邊會出現一羣新經濟雄獅嗎？

sentences.english: A mature male lion rests in the grasses of the Kenyan savanna.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼亞熱帶草原上，一頭成年雄獅正在草叢裏休息。

sentences.english: The female lions are learner and swifter, and as a result, are better hunters than the males.
sentences.chinese: 雌獅相對來說更瘦更敏捷，因此比雄獅更擅於捕獵。

sentences.english: Our thoughts and prayers go out to the lion of the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們向議會的雄獅表達掛念和祈禱。

definition: male eagle/tercel (male falcon used in falconry)
to call the wind and summon the rain (idiom); to exercise magical powers/fig. to stir up troubles
(bird species of China) northern goshawk (Accipiter gentilis)
to bare fangs and brandish claws (idiom); to make threatening gestures
variant of 戰慄|战栗[zhan4 li4]
to present a treasure/to offer a valuable piece of advice/to show off what one treasures
lit. a pair of birds flying close together (idiom)/fig. two hearts beating as one/name of a sweet and sour chicken wing dish
